snippet: Initial claims for state unemployment benefits slipped 1,000 to 264,000 for the week that ended May 9, indicating the jobs market was on solid footing.
abstract: Labor Department reports that weekly applications for unemployment benefits fell 1,000 to seasonally adjusted 164,000; reports producer price index for final demand fell 0.4 in April.
lead_paragraph: Initial claims for state unemployment benefits slipped 1,000 to 264,000 for the week that ended May 9, indicating the jobs market was on solid footing.

headline.main: New Unemployment Claims Fall to Near 15-Year Low
headline.print_headline: New Claims for Unemployment Benefits Fall to Lowest 4-Week Average in 15 Years
